TITLE.P: Commissioning of Enabling Specialist Provision for CITB

SHORT_DESCR.P: CITB requires one or more training Providers to provide ESP for specialist applied-skills programme for occupations leading to a National or Scottish Vocational Qualification (NVQ or SVQ).

MAIN_SITE.P: East of England, East Midlands (England), West Midlands (England), South East (England), South West (England), North West (England), North East (England).

SHORT_DESCR.P: NVQ/VQ Level 2 Asbestos Removal.
— 18 months – 12 months off job modules, followed by 6 months’ portfolio build and assessment.
Successful bidders will be responsible for the marketing and recruitment of the numbers of learners indicated.
April 2018 to March 19 – Max Starts – 24; Max Funding – £96k.
April 2019 to March 20 – Max Starts – 26; Max Funding – £104k.
April 2020 to March 21 – Max Starts – 27; Max Funding – £108k.

Successful bidders will be responsible for the marketing and recruitment of the numbers of learners indicated.
April 2018 to March 19 – Max Starts – 6; Max Funding – £24k.
April 2019 to March 20 – Max Starts – 7; Max Funding – £28k.
April 2020 to March 21 – Max Starts – 8; Max Funding – £32k.

PERFORMANCE_CONDITIONS.P: For all providers, but particularly new providers, contracts will be awarded once a successful CITB site and system inspection has been confirmed. This funding can only be spent on eligible learners from construction in-scope levy registered employers, federations, associations and trade unions which comply with CITBs rules and regulations and flexible and structured fund terms of funding.

INFO_ADD.P: The contracting authority considers that this contract may be suitable for economic operators that are small or medium enterprises (SMEs). However, any selection of tenderers will be based solely on the criteria set out for the procurement.
